alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 21 at 7:55PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Flood Potential Outlook for flash flooding on area burn scars in the following counties: In California, western Siskiyou County. In Oregon, Curry, Douglas, and southwest Josephine counties. This includes the Tyee Complex, Anvil, Flat, Chilcoot, Smith River Complex (in Oregon), and Happy Camp Complex fires. An atmospheric river will produce periods of moderate rainfall for southern Oregon and northern California. While this rainfall will be mostly beneficial, especially for ongoing fires, there is a risk that rainfall rates could be high enough to produce debris flows for some burn scars. A flood potential outlook is issued when there is the potential for flooding along burn scars, rivers, and streams. The exact scenario for flooding remains uncertain. This product will be updated as necessary. Watches and warnings may be issued by the National Weather Service if this situation worsens.
